title: Trial-and-Error-Based Instructional Design Workshop for Leveraging the Flipped Learning Effect

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of elementary social studies curriculum and foundational instructional design knowledge
context.additional_context: A process for pre-service/inservice elementary teachers to analyze socially problematic situations involving reverse discrimination using mobile devices and learn to design teaching strategies through trial and error

learning_goals: Learners can identify key variables causing reversal phenomena in diverse social problem scenarios with 80% accuracy
Learners can complete at least one trial-and-error-based instructional activity design plan using mobile platforms
Learners can analyze the effectiveness of designed instructional strategies through peer assessment using a 3-level rubric
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
